result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J. Dacquisto was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime work/fulltime school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 15 hours community service per week.
Absolute from controlled substances unless medications and only within prescribed amount.

AODA and follow up.
Counseling as recommended.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CM2142, 15CM1754, 17CF914, 18CF2, 18CF19 called: 11:09am
State appears by ADA J.Runde.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty Wright Laufenberg.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed in 17CF and 18CF files.  VRCW
(SAR in 15CM files)

State moves to:
17CF914>> D&RI entire file
18CF2 - Ct. 1 (OMVWOC/Repeater)>>D&RI
18CF19 - Cts. 2, 3, 4 (All Forgery/Repeater)>>D&RI
18CF19 - Ct. 5 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA:
18CF2 - Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>> NO CONTEST
18CF2 - Ct. 3 (Carry Concealed Knife/Repeater)>> NO CONTEST
18CF19 - Ct. 1 (Forgery/Repeater)>> NO CONTEST
18CF19 - Ct. 6 (Theft/Property/Repeater)>> NO CONTEST
18CF19 - Ct. 7 (Theft/Property/Repeater)>> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.
Defendant makes statement and Atty Laufenberg makes statement.

COURT ORDERS:
(Sentence After Revocations)>>
15CM2142 - Cts. 1 and 2>> 9 months MCJ on each count, concurrent to each other and to all other sentences and to 13CF894 and 13CF633; $686 civil judgment for unpaid CC.
15CM1754>> 9 months MCJ, concurrent to all other sentences and to 13CF894 and 13CF633; $441.86 civil judgment for unpaid CC.

18CF2 and 18CF19>> Sentence W/held on all 5 counts; 3 years Probation on each count, concurrent.
CONDITIONS: 180 days MCJ I&S for use on any rules violations; Defendant may participate in Drug Court if accepted; AODA and any follow up recommended; Absolute sobriety; Restitution in 18CF19 to B.R. of $1442.36 (unless Atty Laufenberg files objection); Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, or for any week he does not, defendant must complete 9 hours CS per week; CC on each count; DNA sample (already given) and surcharge; No contact with any victim.
